business.headline: Samsung to invest Rs 1,000 crore in Tamil Nadu plant: ReportSamsung's Tamil Nadu factory currently employs over 2,000 people. In 2022–23, the plant contributed one-fifth of Samsung's Rs 1 lakh crore sales in India.

Sebi revises cut-off timings for overnight mutual fund redemptions. Details hereSebi aims to make sure stock brokers and clearing members use client funds wisely by investing in secure overnight mutual fund schemes (MFOS).

Bengaluru resident shares costly homebuying mistake: 'Don't fall for FOMO'A social media user from Bengaluru shared that he has been living in Bengaluru for the past six years. Like many others, he moved to the city for better career opportunities. Despite being financially stable, he chose to rent rather than buy a flat. But the trouble started soon after.

Pay10 becomes first entity to go live on CBUAE's open finance frameworkThe new license gives Pay10 secure, real-time access to consumer bank accounts, enabling seamless third-party financial services. Gold vs mutual funds: What should you invest in for better returns?Gold is often seen as a safe investment. When markets are shaky or inflation rises, many investors turn to gold. On the other hand, mutual funds, particularly equity funds, are linked to the stock market. When the market does well, your mutual fund investment can grow faster.

Crude oil prices fall below $70, will you get fuel price relief soon?The last reduction in petrol and diesel prices was in March 2024, when prices were cut by Rs 2, just ahead of the general elections. Before that, prices remained unchanged for almost two years.

Aamir Khan was in 'no state' to attend Andaz Apna… re-release amid Pahalgam tragedyA special screening of the 1994 classic 'Andaz Apna Apna' was held earlier this week. However, Aamir Khan opted out of event as he was deeply shaken by the recent terror attack in Pahalgam.

general news.headline: Expel Pakistanis, Amit Shah directs states after India moves to cancel visasFollowing a high-level meeting with top officials, Union Home Minister Amit Shah instructed Chief Ministers of all states to take immediate steps to deport them, a day after India cancelled all existing visas for Pakistani nationals.

Misleading narrative built on 'waqf by user': Centre defends law in Supreme CourtThe Centre further argued that even if all waqfs, including 'waqf by user', had to be mandatorily registered under the original act of 1923, several private and government lands were claimed under 'waqf by user', leading to deprivation of valuable property rights of individuals and unauthorised claims over public properties.

Been doing US's dirty work…: On live TV, Pak minister's big admission on terrorThe remark, a vindication of India's long-held stand, comes at a time when India has held Pakistan indirectly responsible for the terror attack in Pahalgam.

Pahalgam attack: Octroi Post closed for civilians after India, Pak shut borderThe India-Pakistan border at Octroi Post in Jammu and Kashmir's RS Pura sector has been closed to civilian visitors in response to the Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26 people.

When India amassed 5 lakh troops at border, gave Pakistan war scareIn the winter of 1986-1987, India rolled out tanks and troops on a scale not seen in peacetime since World War II. India's Operation Brasstacks stunned Pakistan and made it scramble its military resources and reveal it had nuclear capability. As tensions soar after the Pahalgam massacre, here's a look at the India-Pakistan war that never was.

Top court scolds Rahul Gandhi over Savarkar remark: Your grandmother praised himThe Supreme Court on Thursday came down heavily on Congress leader Rahul Gandhi over his alleged objectionable remarks against freedom fighter Veer Savarkar, saying that the court won't allow such comments against freedom fighters and warning of suo motu action if repeated.

Stop Wagah ceremony, its not military parade but clownery, say some IndiansThe Border Security Force (BSF) has "scaled down" the Retreat Ceremony, popularly referred to as Beating Retreat, at the Attari-Wagah border after the Pahalgam terror attack. Some Indians are now demanding that the ceremony be stopped altogether, calling it "cringe showmanship" and "clownery".

Amid tensions with Pakistan, what does India's 'Aakraman' exercise indicate?India's frontline fighter jets and IAF's top pilots took part in a large-scale military exercise amid heightened tensions with Pakistan. History has ample proof to show that such exercises have preceded conflicts.

How Pakistan's airspace ban will affect your international travelAs political tensions escalate between India and Pakistan following the Pahalgam terror attack, Islamabad has closed its airspace to Indian carriers. Amit Shah holds meet on Indus Waters Treaty after India's diplomatic strike on PakPahalgam terror attack live updates: A crucial meeting on the Indus Water Treaty issue will be held today at the residence of Home Minister Amit Shah. Several Union Ministers, including Jal Shakti Minister CR Patil, are expected to attend the meeting. On Tuesday, 26 people were killed in a terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam. Following the attack, India took a series of sweeping diplomatic and strategic countermeasures against Pakistan, including the effective downgrading of diplomatic relations with Pakistan, closure of key border routes, suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty, and the expulsion of Pakistani military attaches from its High Commission in New Delhi. Follow indiatoday.in for more updates.

No fairytale for Alexandra Eala as Iga Swiatek avenges Miami shockerMadrid Open: World No.2 Iga Swiatek beat 19-year-old Alexandra Eala 4-6, 6-4, 6-2 in the second round and avenged her defeat last month in the Miami Open.

CSK's new boy Ayush Mhatre wows Ravindra Jadeja with massive sixes in netsAyush Mahtre's blistering six-hitting in the CSK nets had Ravindra Jadeja visibly stunned—proof that the 17-year-old can already wow seasoned pros and may soon unleash the same fireworks against Sunrisers Hyderabad.

CSK will continue to bank on experience, but won't overlook youth: FlemingCSK coach Stephen Fleming has said that the team will continue to bank on their experienced campaigner,s but won't overlook youth. CSK's experience approach has been criticised by many as IPL seems to be going for a more youthful and aggressive approach.

Watch: KL Rahul snaps bat in half during DC nets, Axar Patel adds hilarious twistAxar Patel grabbed KL Rahul's snapped handle, called it a "mongoose bat," and the nets erupted in laughter—turning a routine practice mishap into a light-hearted moment that perfectly captured Delhi Capitals' relaxed, team-first spirit.

Virat Kohli scripts history with 3500 T20 runs in BengaluruIPL 2025, RCB vs RR: Virat Kohli completed 3500 T20 runs at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium when Royal Challengers Bengaluru faced Rajasthan Royals on Thursday.

CSK hoping to make IPL 2025 turnaround with RCB blueprint: Stephen FlemingStephen Fleming said that CSK will look to use RCB's IPL 2024 blueprint to make a comeback in the ongoing season. Chennai sits at the bottom of the IPL points table with just 2 wins from 8 matches this season.

4 out of 4: Rajat Patidar's dreadful toss luck in Bengaluru continuesIPL 2025, RCB vs RR: Rajat Patidar's Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) have lost all four tosses at home at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru.

Real Madrid set to miss key players ahead of Copa del Rey final vs BarcelonaReal Madrid are set to miss two of their key players in the Copa del Rey final against arch-rivals FC Barcelona. While David Alaba is out with a muscle injury, the club informed that Eduardo Camavinga has been ruled out for the season.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
